required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Renal Regional Oxygen Saturation During Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation
clinical_study.official_title: Association of Renal Regional Oxygen Saturation and Postprocedural Acute Kidney Injury in Patients Undergoing Transcatheter Aortic Valve Implantation

brief_summary.textblock: This prospective observational study evaluates the association of peri-procedural changes in renal regional oxygen saturation and post-procedural acute kidney injury in patients undergoing transcatheter aortic valve implantation.

detailed_description.textblock: This prospective observational cohort study evaluated the association of renal regional oxygen saturation, measured during transcatheter aortic valve implantation, and post-procedural acute kidney injury. Renal regional oxygen saturation is measured using near-infrared spectroscopy on the skin surface over the kidneys.

primary_outcome.description: increase in serum creatinine compared with baseline or reduced urine output

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during 7 days post-TAVI or until discharge
secondary_outcome.description: stroke, delirium, acute MI, heart failure, new or worsening arrhythmia, mechanical ventilation over 24 h, length of ICU stay, hospital stay, mortality

arm_group.description: Renal regional oxygen saturation is measured by using near infrared spectroscopy during transcatheter aortic valve implantation

intervention.description: Regional oxygen saturation of kidney is monitored using near infrared spectroscopy

study_pop.textblock: Adult patients (age >= 20 years) undergoing transfemoral transcatheter aortic valve implantation are eligible for this observational study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients (>= 20 years old) undergoing transcatheter (transfemoral) aortic valve implantation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Emergent procedure
- Pre-procedural severe renal impairment (eGFR < 30 mL/min/1.73 m2)
- Pre-procedural hemodialysis
- Distance from skin to renal capsule > 4 cm
- Pre-procedural mechanical ventilation
- Refuse to participate
